ground_truth: The screaming Nazgûl fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand. Frodo stumbles, and Sam helps him up. Frodo smiles, and Sam looks down at Frodo, whose face is at peace with his burden destroyed. Frodo and Sam crawl onto a rock as lava streams towards them, and in seconds, their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava. Frodo shuts his eyes and then glances at Sam, who is weeping. Frodo wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava erupting around them and fireballs raining down from the sky. The scene slowly fades to black. Gwaihir, the great eagle, flaps towards the camera, bearing Gandalf on his back and followed by two more eagles. The eagles bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten rocks and snatch Frodo and Sam from the rock. Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano recedes away beneath him, and the wind ruffles his hair before he passes out. Frodo's eyes flutter open, and he looks around slowly; his eyes alight on Gandalf, whose face breaks into a smile. There is laughter as Merry and Pippin run in, jumping on the bed and hugging Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the room, their joy plain. Aragorn joins them, and the Fellowship is complete. Finally, Frodo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet. The scene sweeps over the Minas Tirith walls, racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white. Soaring up, the scene reveals the Court of the Kings, crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor glints in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises, turning to face the crowd, who cheer and clap for their king. The cheers of his people are deafening as Aragorn sings for them, then walks in slow procession down the white-paved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir, who bow before him, and Éomer steps forward to bow in respect. Trumpets sound as a procession of elves, dressed in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas, approach the king. Legolas gestures behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scan among the elves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower. The ranks of elves part, revealing Arwen, her eyes shining. Mortal now, but deeply in love, she is carrying the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The shrieking Nazgûl plunge from the sky in blazes as the ground quakes so fiercely that Frodo and Sam can scarcely remain upright. Frodo trips, and Sam assists him up. Frodo grins, and Sam glances down at Frodo, whose visage is at ease with his load obliterated. Frodo and Sam scramble onto a boulder as magma flows towards them, and in moments, their boulder becomes an isle in a sea of molten magma. Frodo closes his eyes and then looks at Sam, who is sobbing. Frodo drapes an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two diminutive hobbits wait to perish amid the cataclysmic terrain, with magma exploding around them and fireballs descending from the sky. The scene gradually diminishes to black. Gwaihir, the grand eagle, beats towards the camera, carrying Gandalf on his back and followed by two more eagles. The eagles courageously soar amid the falling ash and molten stones and seize Frodo and Sam from the boulder. Frodo's visage can be seen as the blazing volcano withdraws away beneath him, and the breeze tousles his hair before he loses consciousness. Frodo's eyes flicker open, and he glances around slowly; his eyes settle on Gandalf, whose visage lights into a grin. There is merriment as Merry and Pippin dash in, leaping on the bed and embracing Frodo. Gimli and Legolas step into the room, their happiness evident. Aragorn joins them, and the Fellowship is whole. Finally, Frodo's eyes settle upon a figure standing aside from the others: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes lock. The scene sweeps over the Minas Tirith walls, racing towards the summit of the city through a flurry of white blossom petals as Minas Tirith is renewed and gleams white. Soaring up, the scene unveils the Court of the Kings, packed with 4000 individuals cramming the broad path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor sparkles in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn grins up at Gandalf and slowly stands, turning to face the crowd, who shout and applaud for their king. The shouts of his people are thunderous as Aragorn sings for them, then moves in slow parade down the white-paved path while the crowd inclines their heads in reverence to their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir, who kneel before him, and Éomer steps forward to kneel in reverence. Trumpets echo as a parade of elves, clad in glistening silvers and whites, led by Legolas, approach the king. Legolas signals behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scrutinize among the elves. A banner is borne aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full bloom. The ranks of elves divide, displaying Arwen, her eyes sparkling. Mortal now, but profoundly in love, she is carrying the emblem of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond observes, his visage lighting into a grin. Aragorn and Arwen hug, then move through the crowd towards four small figures who stand anxiously at the end of the parade.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The Nazgûl screamingly fall from the sky in flames as the ground is shaken so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand. Frodo stumbles, and he is helped up by Sam. A smile is given by Frodo, and Frodo is looked down upon by Sam, whose face is at peace with the burden having been destroyed. A rock is crawled onto by Frodo and Sam as lava streams towards them, and in seconds, their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava. Frodo's eyes are shut, and then Sam is glanced at by him, who is weeping. An arm is wrapped by Frodo around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava being erupted around them and fireballs raining down from the sky. The black scene is slowly faded to. The camera is flapped towards by Gwaihir, the great eagle, bearing Gandalf on his back and being followed by two more eagles. Frodo and Sam are snatched by the eagles bravely flying amid the raining ash and molten rocks from the rock. Frodo's face is seen as the fiery volcano is receded away beneath him, and his hair is ruffled by the wind before he passes out. Frodo's eyes are fluttered open, and a slow look is given around; his eyes alight on Gandalf, whose face breaks into a smile. Merry and Pippin run in with laughter, jumping on the bed and hugging Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the room, and plain joy is shown by them. They are joined by Aragorn, and the Fellowship is completed. Finally, upon a figure standing apart from the others, Frodo's eyes fall: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet. The Minas Tirith walls are swept over by the scene, racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white. The scene is revealed to soar up, showing the Court of the Kings, crowded with 4000 people who are cramming the wide path leading to the tower. The brilliant light makes the Crown of Gondor glint as it is placed upon Aragorn's head by Gandalf. Up at Gandalf, Aragorn smiles and is slowly risen, turning to face the crowd, who cheer and clap for their king. Deafen the cheers of his people as he sings for them, then walk in slow procession down the white-paved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. Eowyn and Faramir are passed by Aragorn, who bow before him, and Éomer steps forward to bow in respect. Trumpets sound as the king is approached by a procession of elves, dressed in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas. Behind him is gestured by Legolas, and among the elves, Aragorn’s eyes scan. Aloft is carried a banner bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower. The ranks of elves part, revealing Arwen, her eyes shining. Mortal now, but deeply in love, she carries the standard of Gondor. She is kissed by Aragorn as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a smile. An embrace is shared by Aragorn and Arwen, then they walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Nazgûl fall in flames as the ground shakes violently, making Frodo and Sam struggle to stand. Sam helps Frodo up, who smiles peacefully with his burden gone. They crawl onto a rock as lava surrounds them, becoming an island in a sea of molten lava. Frodo closes his eyes, then looks at a weeping Sam. Frodo wraps an arm around Sam as they await their fate amid erupting lava and fireballs. The scene fades to black. Gwaihir, the great eagle, approaches with Gandalf and two more eagles, rescuing Frodo and Sam. Frodo's face is visible as the volcano recedes, and he passes out. He awakens to see Gandalf smiling. Merry and Pippin joyfully jump on the bed, hugging Frodo. Gimli, Legolas, and Aragorn join, completing the Fellowship. Frodo's eyes meet Sam's. The scene shifts to Minas Tirith, restored and gleaming white. The Court of the Kings is crowded with 4000 people. Gandalf crowns Aragorn, who rises to cheers and sings for his people. Aragorn walks down the path as the crowd bows. Eowyn, Faramir, and Éomer bow in respect. Trumpets sound as elves, led by Legolas, approach. A banner with the White Tree of Gondor is carried, revealing Arwen, now mortal and in love, carrying Gondor's standard. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond smiles. Aragorn and Arwen embrace and walk towards four small figures at the procession's end.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Nazgûl fall in flames as the ground shakes violently, making Frodo and Sam struggle to stand. Sam helps Frodo up, who smiles peacefully with his burden gone. They crawl onto a rock, soon surrounded by lava. Frodo comforts a weeping Sam as they await death amid erupting lava and fireballs. The scene fades to black. Gwaihir, the eagle, carries Gandalf and two more eagles, rescuing Frodo and Sam. Frodo sees the volcano recede and faints. He awakens to Gandalf's smile, then Merry and Pippin joyfully hug him. Gimli, Legolas, and Aragorn join, completing the Fellowship. Frodo and Sam share a look. The scene shifts to Minas Tirith, restored and gleaming. Gandalf crowns Aragorn, who rises to cheers, sings, and walks down the path as the crowd bows. Aragorn passes Eowyn, Faramir, and Éomer, who bow. Trumpets announce elves led by Legolas. Aragorn sees Arwen, now mortal, carrying Gondor's standard. They kiss as Elrond smiles. Aragorn and Arwen embrace and walk towards four nervous figures at the procession's end.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The terrifying Nazgûl, with their piercing screams, plummet from the sky engulfed in flames, while the ground beneath shakes with such intensity that Frodo and Sam find it nearly impossible to remain standing. Frodo loses his balance, and Sam quickly reaches out to help him regain his footing. Frodo offers a grateful smile, and Sam gazes down at Frodo, whose expression is serene now that the heavy burden has been lifted and destroyed. The two hobbits, Frodo and Sam, crawl onto a protruding rock as streams of molten lava flow menacingly towards them, and within moments, their rock is transformed into a small island surrounded by a sea of fiery lava. Frodo closes his eyes momentarily, then opens them to see Sam, who is weeping. Frodo gently wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder, and together, the two diminutive hobbits brace themselves for the end, waiting to meet their fate amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava erupting violently around them and fireballs descending from the sky. The scene gradually fades to black. Suddenly, Gwaihir, the majestic great eagle, flaps his powerful wings as he approaches the camera, carrying Gandalf on his back and followed closely by two more eagles. The eagles courageously navigate through the falling ash and molten rocks, skillfully rescuing Frodo and Sam from their precarious perch on the rock. As the fiery volcano recedes into the distance below him, Frodo's face is visible, and the wind tousles his hair before he loses consciousness. Frodo's eyes flutter open, and he slowly takes in his surroundings; his gaze lands on Gandalf, whose face lights up with a warm smile. Laughter fills the air as Merry and Pippin burst into the room, leaping onto the bed and embracing Frodo with joy. Gimli and Legolas enter, their happiness evident. Aragorn joins them, completing the Fellowship. At last, Frodo's eyes find a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Frodo and Sam share a meaningful glance. The scene transitions to a sweeping view over the walls of Minas Tirith, racing upwards through a flurry of white flower petals as the city is restored to its former glory, gleaming brilliantly white. Ascending further, the scene reveals the Court of the Kings, teeming with 4,000 people who fill the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor sparkles in the radiant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises, turning to face the jubilant crowd, who erupt into cheers and applause for their new king. The cheers of his people are thunderous as Aragorn sings for them, then proceeds in a slow, dignified procession down the white-paved path while the crowd respectfully bows their heads to honor their newly crowned king. As Aragorn passes by, Eowyn and Faramir bow before him, and Éomer steps forward to offer his respect with a bow. The sound of trumpets fills the air as a procession of elves, adorned in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas, approaches the king. Legolas gestures behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scan the ranks of elves. A banner is held high, bearing the emblem of the White Tree of Gondor in full bloom. The elves part, revealing Arwen, her eyes shining with love. Now mortal, yet deeply in love, she carries the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her tenderly as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a proud smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then walk hand in hand through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The terrifying Nazgûl, with their bone-chilling, ear-piercing screams, plummet swiftly from the ominous sky, completely engulfed in raging flames. Meanwhile, the very ground beneath them shakes with such incredible intensity that Frodo and Sam find it nearly impossible to remain standing on their feet. Frodo loses his balance, swaying precariously, and Sam, ever loyal and quick to act, reaches out with urgency to help him regain his footing. Frodo offers a grateful, warm smile in return, and Sam gazes down at Frodo, whose face is now serene and peaceful, as the heavy burden has finally been lifted and utterly destroyed. The two courageous hobbits, Frodo and Sam, crawl with determination onto a protruding rock as streams of molten, fiery lava flow menacingly toward them, and within moments, transform their rock into a small island surrounded by a vast sea of fiery lava. Frodo closes his eyes momentarily, then opens them to see Sam, who is weeping softly. Frodo gently wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder, offering comfort, and together, the two diminutive hobbits brace themselves for the end, waiting to meet their fate amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava erupting violently around them and fireballs descending menacingly from the sky. The intense scene gradually fades into blackness. Suddenly, Gwaihir, the majestic great eagle, flaps his powerful wings as he approaches the camera, carrying Gandalf securely on his back and followed closely by two more brave eagles. The eagles courageously navigate meticulously through the falling ash and molten rocks, skillfully rescuing Frodo and Sam from their hazardous, precarious perch on the rock. As the fiery, erupting volcano recedes into the distance below him, Frodo's face is visible, and the wind tousles his hair before he loses consciousness. Frodo's eyes begin to flutter open, and he slowly takes in his surroundings; his gaze comes to rest on Gandalf, whose face lights up with a warm, welcoming smile. Laughter fills the air as Merry and Pippin burst energetically into the room, leaping with joy onto the bed and enthusiastically embracing Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter next, their happiness evident on their smiling faces. Aragorn soon joins them, completing the reunion of the Fellowship. At last, Frodo's eyes find a familiar figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Frodo and Sam share a meaningful, silent glance of understanding. The scene majestically transitions to a sweeping view over the walls of Minas Tirith, racing upwards through a flurry of delicate white flower petals as the city is beautifully restored to its former glory, now gleaming brilliantly white. Ascending further, the scene reveals the magnificent Court of the Kings, teeming with 4,000 people who fill the wide path leading to the towering structure. The Crown of Gondor sparkles magnificently in the radiant light as Gandalf carefully places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf, then slowly rises, turning to face the jubilant crowd, who erupt into cheers and applause for their newly crowned king. The cheers of his people are thunderous as Aragorn sings for them, then proceeds in a slow, dignified procession down the white-paved path while the crowd respectfully bows their heads to honor their newly crowned king. As Aragorn passes by, Eowyn and Faramir bow graciously before him, and Éomer steps forward to offer his respect with a solemn bow. The sound of trumpets fills the air majestically as a grand procession of elves, adorned in shimmering silvers and whites, led by the graceful Legolas, approaches the king. Legolas gestures behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scan the ranks of elves intently. A banner is held high, bearing the emblem of the White Tree of Gondor, depicted in full, magnificent bloom. The elves part gracefully, revealing Arwen, her eyes shining with longing love. Now mortal, yet deeply in love, she carries the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her tenderly as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a proud, approving smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace warmly, then walk hand in hand through the cheering crowd towards the four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the grand procession.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The screaming Nazgûl plummet from the sky, engulfed in flames, as the ground beneath Frodo and Sam trembles with such intensity that they struggle to maintain their balance. Frodo loses his footing, and Sam quickly reaches out to steady him, helping him back to his feet. Frodo, now upright, offers a grateful smile, and Sam gazes down at him, noticing the serene expression on Frodo's face, a reflection of the relief he feels with the destruction of his burden. Together, Frodo and Sam painstakingly crawl onto a protruding rock, seeking refuge as the relentless flow of lava advances towards them. Within moments, their rocky perch is transformed into a solitary island amidst a vast, fiery sea of molten lava. Frodo closes his eyes momentarily, then opens them to see Sam, who is overcome with emotion and weeping. In a gesture of comfort, Frodo wraps his arm around Sam's shoulder, and the two diminutive hobbits brace themselves for the end, surrounded by the apocalyptic landscape where lava erupts violently and fireballs cascade from the sky. The scene gradually fades to black, and Gwaihir, the majestic eagle, soars into view, carrying Gandalf on his back, with two more eagles following closely behind. The eagles navigate courageously through the falling ash and molten debris, swooping down to rescue Frodo and Sam from their precarious position on the rock. As they ascend, Frodo's face is visible, the fiery volcano shrinking away beneath him, and the wind tousles his hair before he succumbs to unconsciousness. When Frodo's eyes flutter open, he slowly surveys his surroundings, his gaze eventually settling on Gandalf, whose face lights up with a warm smile. Laughter fills the air as Merry and Pippin burst into the room, leaping onto the bed and enveloping Frodo in a joyful embrace. Gimli and Legolas enter, their happiness evident, and Aragorn joins them, completing the Fellowship. Frodo's attention finally shifts to a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Their eyes meet in a moment of profound connection. The scene transitions to a sweeping view over the walls of Minas Tirith, racing upwards through a flurry of white flower petals as the city is restored to its former glory, gleaming brilliantly. The perspective ascends to reveal the Court of the Kings, teeming with 4000 people who line the wide path leading to the tower. In the radiant light, the Crown of Gondor sparkles as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn beams up at Gandalf, then rises slowly, turning to face the jubilant crowd, who erupt in cheers and applause for their newly crowned king. The overwhelming sound of their adulation fills the air as Aragorn sings for them, then proceeds down the white-paved path in a stately procession, the crowd bowing their heads in reverence. As Aragorn passes, Eowyn and Faramir bow before him, and Éomer steps forward to pay his respects with a bow. The sound of trumpets heralds the approach of a procession of elves, clad in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas. Legolas gestures behind him, prompting Aragorn to scan the ranks of elves. A banner is held high, emblazoned with the White Tree of Gondor in full bloom. The elves part to reveal Arwen, her eyes radiant with love, now mortal but deeply in love, carrying the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her tenderly as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then make their way through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Nazgûl plummet from the sky in flames as the ground shakes violently, causing Frodo and Sam to struggle to stand. Sam helps Frodo up, and they share a moment of peace with the destruction of the Ring. They crawl onto a rock, which quickly becomes an island in a sea of lava. As they await their fate amid the erupting landscape, Frodo comforts a weeping Sam. The scene fades to black as Gwaihir, the great eagle, arrives with Gandalf and two other eagles, rescuing Frodo and Sam from the rock. As the volcano recedes below, Frodo passes out, only to awaken and find Gandalf smiling at him. Merry and Pippin joyfully join Frodo, followed by Gimli, Legolas, and Aragorn, completing the Fellowship. Frodo's gaze meets Sam's, standing apart from the others. The scene transitions to Minas Tirith, restored and gleaming, as the Court of the Kings fills with thousands. Gandalf crowns Aragorn, who rises to face the cheering crowd. As Aragorn sings and processes down the path, the people bow in respect. He passes Eowyn, Faramir, and Éomer, who bow before him. Trumpets announce a procession of elves led by Legolas, revealing Arwen, now mortal and deeply in love, carrying Gondor's standard. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond smiles, and they embrace before walking towards the four hobbits at the procession's end.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The screaming Nazgûl, terrifying winged servants of Sauron known for their ear-piercing cries, fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand. Frodo stumbles, and Sam helps him up. Frodo smiles, and Sam looks down at Frodo, whose face is at peace with his burden, the One Ring which once threatened Middle-earth, now destroyed. Frodo and Sam crawl onto a rock as lava, spewing from the fiery Mount Doom, streams towards them, and in seconds, their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava. Frodo shuts his eyes and then glances at Sam, who is weeping, overwhelmed by both relief and despair. Frodo wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits from the Shire wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava erupting around them and fireballs raining down from the sky. The scene slowly fades to black. Gwaihir, the great eagle renowned for his strength and wisdom, flaps towards the camera, bearing Gandalf, the wise and powerful wizard, on his back and followed by two more eagles. The eagles bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten rocks and snatch Frodo and Sam from the rock. Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano of Mount Doom recedes away beneath him, and the wind ruffles his hair before he passes out. Frodo's eyes flutter open, and he looks around slowly; his eyes alight on Gandalf, whose face breaks into a smile, filled with relief and joy. There is laughter as Merry and Pippin, Frodo's cousins and fellow hobbits, run in, jumping on the bed and hugging Frodo. Gimli, the stout-hearted dwarf, and Legolas, the skilled elven archer, enter the room, their joy plain. Aragorn, the rightful heir to the throne of Gondor, joins them, and the Fellowship is complete. Finally, Frodo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam, his loyal companion. Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet. The scene sweeps over the walls of Minas Tirith, the majestic city of Gondor, racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white. Soaring up, the scene reveals the Court of the Kings, crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor, a symbol of Aragorn's rightful rule, glints in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises, turning to face the crowd, who cheer and clap for their king, newly crowned. The cheers of his people are deafening as Aragorn sings for them, then walks in slow procession down the white-paved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn, the valiant shieldmaiden of Rohan, and Faramir, the noble steward of Gondor, who bow before him, and Éomer, now king of Rohan, steps forward to bow in respect. Trumpets sound as a procession of elves, dressed in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas, approach the king. Legolas gestures behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scan among the elves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower, a symbol of renewal and hope. The ranks of elves part, revealing Arwen, daughter of Elrond and once an immortal, her eyes shining. Mortal now, but deeply in love, she is carrying the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her, sealing their union, as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession, witnesses to the end of their journey and the beginning of a new era.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The screaming Nazgûl fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand. Frodo stumbles and Sam helps him up. Frodo smiles and Sam looks down at Frodo whose face is at peace with his burden destroyed. Frodo and Sam crawl onto a rock as lava streams towards them and in seconds their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava. Frodo shuts his eyes and then glances at Sam who is weeping. Frodo wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape with lava erupting around them and fireballs raining down from the sky. The scene slowly fades to black. Gwaihir the great eagle flaps towards the camera bearing Gandalf on his back and followed by two more eagles. The eagles bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten rocks and snatch Frodo and Sam from the rock. Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano recedes away beneath him and the wind ruffles his hair before he passes out. Frodo's eyes flutter open and he looks around slowly his eyes alight on Gandalf whose face breaks into a smile. There is laughter as Merry and Pippin run in jumping on the bed and hugging Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the room their joy plain. Aragorn joins them and the Fellowship is complete. Finally Frodo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet. The scene sweeps over the Minas Tirith walls racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white. Soaring up the scene reveals the Court of the Kings crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor glints in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises turning to face the crowd who cheer and clap for their king. The cheers of his people are deafening as Aragorn sings for them then walks in slow procession down the whitepaved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir who bow before him and Éomer steps forward to bow in respect. Trumpets sound as a procession of elves dressed in shimmering silvers and whites led by Legolas approach the king. Legolas gestures behind him and Aragorn’s eyes scan among the elves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower. The ranks of elves part revealing Arwen her eyes shining Mortal now but deeply in love. she is carrying the standard of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond looks on his face breaking into a smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The screaming squirrels fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that a kangaroo and a duck can barely stand. The kangaroo stumbles, and the duck helps the kangaroo up. The kangaroo smiles, and the duck looks down at the kangaroo, whose face is at peace with his burden destroyed. The kangaroo and the duck crawl onto a rock as lava streams towards them, and in seconds, their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava. The kangaroo shuts his eyes and then glances at the duck, who is weeping. The kangaroo wraps an arm around the duck's shoulder as the two tiny hamsters wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape, with lava erupting around them and fireballs raining down from the sky. The scene slowly fades to black. A dinosaur flaps towards the camera, bearing a wizard on its back and followed by two more dinosaurs. The dinosaurs bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten rocks and snatch the kangaroo and the duck from the rock. The kangaroo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano recedes away beneath him, and the wind ruffles his hair before he passes out. The kangaroo's eyes flutter open, and he looks around slowly; his eyes alight on a giraffe, whose face breaks into a smile. There is laughter as a wolf and a penguin run in, jumping on the bed and hugging the kangaroo. A lion and a bear enter the room, their joy plain. A tiger joins them, and the Fellowship is complete. Finally, the kangaroo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others: it is the duck. The kangaroo's and the duck's eyes meet. The scene sweeps over the Minas Tirith walls, racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white. Soaring up, the scene reveals the Court of the Kings, crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor glints in the brilliant light as a chimpanzee places it upon the tiger's head. The tiger smiles up at the chimpanzee and slowly rises, turning to face the crowd, who cheer and clap for their king. The cheers of his people are deafening as the tiger sings for them, then walks in slow procession down the white-paved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. The tiger passes a swan and a fox, who bow before him, and a turtle steps forward to bow in respect. Trumpets sound as a procession of elves, dressed in shimmering silvers and whites, led by a raccoon, approach the king. The raccoon gestures behind him, and the tiger’s eyes scan among the elves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower. The ranks of elves part, revealing a mermaid, her eyes shining. Mortal now, but deeply in love, she is carrying the standard of Gondor. The tiger kisses her as a dragon looks on, his face breaking into a smile. The tiger and the mermaid embrace, then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The screaming dragons fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand. Frodo stumbles, and Sam helps him up. Frodo smiles, and Sam looks down at Frodo, whose face is at peace with his burden destroyed. Frodo and Sam crawl onto a crate as honey streams towards them, and in seconds, their crate becomes an island in a sea of molten caramel. Frodo shuts his eyes and then glances at Sam, who is weeping. Frodo wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape, with caramel erupting around them and gumdrops raining down from the sky. The scene slowly fades to black. A seagull, the great bird, flaps towards the camera, bearing Gandalf on its back and followed by two more pelicans. The birds bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten candy and snatch Frodo and Sam from the crate. Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery sugar mountain recedes away beneath him, and the breeze ruffles his hair before he passes out. Frodo's eyes flutter open, and he looks around slowly; his eyes alight on Gandalf, whose face breaks into a smile. There is laughter as Merry and Pippin run in, jumping on the sofa and hugging Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the hall, their joy plain. Aragorn joins them, and the Fellowship is complete. Finally, Frodo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet. The scene sweeps over the Mordor walls, racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white cherry blossoms as Mordor is restored and gleams white. Soaring up, the scene reveals the Hall of the Kings, crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide avenue leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor glints in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises, turning to face the crowd, who cheer and clap for their king. The cheers of his people are deafening as Aragorn sings for them, then walks in slow procession down the marble path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir, who bow before him, and Éomer steps forward to bow in respect. Horns sound as a procession of dwarves, dressed in shimmering golds and reds, led by Legolas, approach the king. Legolas gestures behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes scan among the dwarves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full fruit. The ranks of dwarves part, revealing Arwen, her eyes shining. Mortal now, but deeply in love, she is carrying the insignia of Gondor. Aragorn kisses her as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a smile. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The screaming Nazgûl glide through the sky in a blaze as the ground trembles so gently that Frodo and Sam can easily sit. Frodo leans, and Sam steadies him. Frodo frowns, and Sam glances up at Frodo, whose face is at ease with his burden resolved. Frodo and Sam jump onto a rock as lava drips towards them, and in moments, their rock becomes a platform in an ocean of molten lava. Frodo opens his eyes and then stares at Sam, who is laughing. Frodo places a hand on Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits prepare to survive amid the serene landscape, with lava bubbling around them and fireballs floating down from the sky. The scene suddenly turns to black. Gwaihir, the great eagle, sails towards the camera, carrying Gandalf on his back and accompanied by two more eagles. The eagles calmly hover amid the drifting ash and molten rocks and lift Frodo and Sam from the rock. Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano fades away beneath him, and the wind tickles his hair before he dozes off. Frodo's eyes spring open, and he gazes around quickly; his eyes settle on Gandalf, whose face breaks into a grin. There is laughter as Merry and Pippin rush in, bouncing on the bed and cuddling Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the room, their joy evident. Aragorn joins them, and the Fellowship is reunited. Finally, Frodo's eyes focus on a figure standing apart from the others: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes connect. The scene glides over the Minas Tirith walls, rolling towards the top of the city through a drizzle of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is renewed and glows white. Soaring up, the scene discloses the Court of the Kings, teeming with 4000 people filling the wide path leading to the tower. The Crown of Gondor gleams in the dazzling light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head. Aragorn frowns up at Gandalf and slowly stands, turning to face the crowd, who shout and whisper for their king. The whispers of his people are soft as Aragorn gestures for them, then strides in slow procession down the white-paved path while the crowd raises their heads in admiration of their new king. Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir, who raise their heads before him, and Éomer steps forward to wave in acknowledgment. Trumpets blare as a parade of elves, dressed in shimmering silvers and whites, led by Legolas, greet the king. Legolas indicates behind him, and Aragorn’s eyes wander among the elves. A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full bloom. The ranks of elves close, revealing Arwen, her eyes twinkling. Mortal now, but profoundly in love, she is holding the standard of Gondor. Aragorn embraces her as Elrond looks on, his face breaking into a grin. Aragorn and Arwen hold hands, then saunter through the crowd towards four small figures who stand confidently at the end of the procession.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The yelling accordion descend from the clouds in sparks as the ocean rattles so fiercely that the pencil and the eraser can hardly lean. The pencil tumbles, and the eraser assists it up. The pencil grins, and the eraser glances down at the pencil, whose mouth is at ease with its luggage shattered. The pencil and the eraser scramble onto a basket as syrup streams towards them, and in moments, their basket becomes a peninsula in a lake of melted syrup. The pencil closes its ears and then peers at the eraser, who is sobbing. The pencil wraps a ribbon around the eraser's elbow as the two tiny cacti wait to expire amid the tremendous scenery, with syrup bursting around them and icicles pouring down from the clouds. The frame gradually dims to orange. The hippo, the grand butterfly, flutters towards the lens, carrying the lighthouse on its wing and trailed by two more butterflies. The butterflies courageously navigate amid the falling feathers and steaming stones and snatch the pencil and the eraser from the basket. The pencil's mouth can be spotted as the icy mountain retreats away beneath it, and the breeze tousles its thread before it dozes off. The pencil's ears flutter open, and it gazes around lazily; its ears land on the lighthouse, whose nose splits into a grin. There is giggling as the stapler and the paintbrush skip in, bouncing on the couch and embracing the pencil. The trumpet and the raccoon enter the attic, their glee evident. The chandelier joins them, and the Folio is complete. Finally, the pencil's ears settle upon a shadow standing apart from the rest: it is the eraser. The pencil's and the eraser's ears connect. The frame swirls over the Venice Beach walls, dashing towards the peak of the village through a tempest of red snowflakes as Venice Beach is repaired and shines pink. Ascending, the frame reveals the Market of the Stars, packed with 4000 bicycles stuffing the narrow bridge leading to the lighthouse. The Tiara of Pancakes sparkles in the dazzling moonlight as the lighthouse places it upon the chandelier's hat. The chandelier beams up at the lighthouse and slowly elevates, pivoting to face the bicycles, who shout and clap for their monarch. The shouts of its bicycles are overpowering as the chandelier dances for them, then strolls in gradual parade down the pink-cobbled bridge while the bicycles lower their hats in admiration of their new monarch. The chandelier passes the spoon and the backpack, who nod before it, and the skateboard strides forward to nod in admiration. Guitars holler as a parade of lamps, attired in glistening blues and blacks, led by the raccoon, approach the monarch. The raccoon signals behind it, and the chandelier’s ears survey among the lamps. A flag is hoisted high bearing the Golden Leaf of Pancakes in full blossom. The rows of lamps divide, revealing the vase, its ears glowing. Immortal now, but profoundly in awe, it is lifting the emblem of Pancakes. The chandelier nuzzles it as the cactus observes, its mouth splitting into a grin. The chandelier and the vase cuddle, then stroll through the bicycles towards four tiny triangles who linger anxiously at the terminus of the parade.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The howling dragons soar from the ocean in sparks as the sky trembles so gently that Mary and John can hardly kneel. Mary crawls, and John drags her forward. Mary frowns, and John stares at Mary, whose heart is at war with her treasure vanished. Mary and John roll onto a tree as rivers flow past them, and in moments, their tree becomes a hill in a field of steaming water. Mary opens her mouth and then peers at John, who is laughing. Mary places a hat on John's shoulder as the two tiny rabbits wait to sleep amid the serene landscape, with flowers blooming around them and raindrops gliding down from the air. The scene quickly blurs to white. Athene, the small squirrel, darts towards the stage, carrying Clara on her paws and followed by two more foxes. The foxes swiftly leap amid the falling leaves and cracking twigs and pull Mary and John from the tree. Mary's hand can be seen as the calm river disappears away beneath her, and the breeze tousles her hair before she drifts off. Mary's ears twitch open, and she glances around quickly; her ears catch on Clara, whose heart bursts into a melody. There is singing as Billy and Tom hop in, dancing on the chair and tickling Mary. Greg and Lucy enter the house, their glee hidden. Steve joins them, and the Alliance is incomplete. Finally, Mary's ears land upon a figure sitting away from the rest: it is John. Mary's and John's ears lock. The view flips over the Rivendell mountains, sliding towards the base of the castle through a cascade of red maple leaves as Rivendell is renewed and shines silver. Gliding down, the view unveils the Palace of the Lords, crowded with 4000 animals hopping the narrow road leading to the fortress. The Crown of Elves flashes in the dim glow as Clara places it upon Steve's shoulder. Steve laughs down at Clara and quickly descends, twisting to face the animals, who sigh and nod for their leader. The sighs of his followers are muted as Steve dances for them, then strides in rapid retreat up the grey-dusted path while the animals shake their heads in honor to their old leader. Steve skips over Anne and Robert, who bow beside him, and Brian sings forward to laugh in joy. Bells ring as a parade of dwarves, dressed in vibrant golds and greens, led by Lucy, greet the leader. Lucy bows behind her, and Steve’s ears wander among the dwarves. A musical note is floated aloft bearing the Black Eagle of Rivendell in shy silence. The swarm of dwarves gather, revealing Elizabeth, her hands warming. Immortal now, but barely in trust, she is holding the melody of Rivendell. Steve hugs her as Elves watches over, his heart bursting into a song. Steve and Elizabeth twirl, then sprint past the animals toward four tall trees that wave confidently at the door of the parade.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The laughing griffins rise from the ocean in bubbles as the air vibrates so gently that Frodo and Sam can barely dance. Frodo twirls, and Sam nudges him upright. Frodo winks, and Sam gazes down at Frodo, whose face is at peace with his journey completed. Frodo and Sam float onto a cloud as water cascades towards them, and in moments, their cloud becomes a raft in a sea of sparkling water. Frodo blinks his eyes and then beams at Sam, who is giggling. Frodo drapes a hand around Sam's waist as the two tiny hobbits wait to dream amid the tranquil seascape, with water spouting around them and blossoms drifting down from the sky. The scene slowly turns to white. Gwaihir, the grand dragon, glides towards the audience, carrying Gandalf on his wing and accompanied by two more dragons. The dragons deftly swim amid the drifting blossoms and rainbow droplets and scoop Frodo and Sam from the cloud. Frodo's grin can be seen as the snowy mountain recedes away beneath him, and the breeze tickles his nose before he drifts asleep. Frodo's eyes blink open, and he listens intently; his eyes land on Gandalf, whose face lights up in a grin. There is music as Merry and Pippin waltz in, dancing on the floor and embracing Frodo. Gimli and Legolas enter the hall, their happiness evident. Aragorn joins them, and the Fellowship is united. Finally, Frodo's eyes settle upon a character standing apart from the group: it is Sam. Frodo's and Sam's eyes connect. The scene swoops over the Minas Tirith towers, drifting towards the heart of the city through a flurry of white snowflakes as Minas Tirith is renewed and shines white. Gliding up, the scene reveals the Plaza of the Kings, filled with 4000 people swaying on the wide path leading to the turret. The Diadem of Gondor sparkles in the radiant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's brow. Aragorn nods up at Gandalf and gently stands, turning to greet the crowd, who sing and sway for their leader. The songs of his people are harmonious as Aragorn whispers for them, then moves in slow ceremony down the golden-bricked route while the crowd lifts their heads in admiration to their new leader. Aragorn encounters Eowyn and Faramir, who curtsy before him, and Éomer steps forward to curtsy in admiration. Harps play as a parade of dwarves, clad in glowing golds and bronzes, led by Legolas, approach the leader. Legolas signals behind him, and Aragorn’s gaze roams among the dwarves. A standard is held high bearing the Silver Tree of Gondor in full leaf. The lines of dwarves divide, unveiling Arwen, her eyes glowing. Human now, but profoundly devoted, she is bearing the insignia of Gondor. Aragorn whispers to her as Elrond observes, his face lighting up in a grin. Aragorn and Arwen embrace, then glide through the assembly towards four small beings who stand excitedly at the start of the parade.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The wailing penguins ascend from the ocean in bubbles as the sky trembles so gently that Rupert and Tom can hardly snooze. Rupert dances, and Tom nudges him down. Rupert frowns, and Tom gazes up at Rupert, whose hands are uneasy with his pebble discovered. Rupert and Tom swim onto a cliff as water trickles away from them, and in minutes, their cliff becomes a forest in a sea of shimmering water. Rupert opens his mouth and then stares at Tom, who is laughing. Rupert drapes a leg around Tom's ankle as the two giant giraffes sleep to live among the ordinary seascape, with water drifting below them and geysers floating up to the moon. The movie quickly blurs to white. Rex, the tiny beetle, scuttles towards the bush, pushing Walter on his shell and followed by three more beetles. The beetles swiftly crawl beside the rising dust and scattered branches and pluck Rupert and Tom from the cliff. Rupert's hands can be felt as the silent mountain slides toward above him, and the breeze tickles his toes before he fades in. Rupert's mouth snaps shut, and he listens around quickly; his mouth settles on Walter, whose hands break into a laugh. There is crying as Percy and Peter fly out, sitting on the chair and pushing Rupert. Gregory and Vincent leave the building, their envy loud. Bartholomew leaves them, and the Group is divided. Finally, Rupert's mouth rises upon a sound leaping close to the group: it is Tom. Rupert's and Tom's mouths greet. The movie floats under the Castle Rock floors, rumbling past the base of the dessert inside a drizzle of black tree branches as Castle Rock is destroyed and reflects black. Diving down, the movie hides the Park of the Giants, empty of 4000 cats exiting the narrow river leading to the sand. The Ring of Mordor flashes in the dim light as Walter lifts it under Bartholomew's ear. Bartholomew frowns down at Walter and quickly falls, hiding to face the pack, who boo and wave at their chef. The boos of his enemies are squeaking as Bartholomew dances for them, then runs in fast silence up the black-rocked river while the pack lifts their arms in disdain to their old chef. Bartholomew greets Leslie and Frank, who stretch against him, and Lester jumps backward to kneel in disgust. Violins squeal as a silence of bears, hidden in glowing greens and blacks, led by Vincent, leave the chef. Vincent signals in front of him, and Bartholomew’s ears see around the bears. A scarf is pulled below dragging the Black Cloud of Mordor in bare branch. The lines of bears skip, obscuring Matilda, her hands sobbing. Ghostly now, but highly in hatred, she is wearing the robe of Mordor. Bartholomew punches her as Elliot frowns in, his hands breaking into a laugh. Bartholomew and Matilda separate, then nap above the pack away from four massive plants who swim calmly at the start of the silence.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Nazgûl fall in flames as the ground violently shakes, causing Frodo and Sam to struggle standing. Sam aids Frodo, who feels at peace with the destroyed burden. They find themselves stranded on a rock amid molten lava and fireballs. Frodo comforts the weeping Sam as they wait for the inevitable. The scene fades to black, and Gwaihir, with Gandalf and other eagles, saves them. Frodo awakens to find Gandalf smiling, joined by the joyful Fellowship in Minas Tirith. The city shines as Gandalf crowns Aragorn king. The crowd cheers as Aragorn walks the white path, bowing heads in respect. Among cheering elves led by Legolas, Arwen appears, mortal but in love, to embrace Aragorn. Elrond smiles as Aragorn, with Arwen, approaches the hobbits waiting nervously.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Aragorn and Arwen embrace then walk through the crowd towards four small figures who stand nervously at the end of the procession Aragorn kisses her as Elrond looks on his face breaking into a smile  she is carrying the standard of Gondor  The ranks of elves part revealing Arwen her eyes shining Mortal now but deeply in love  A banner is carried aloft bearing the White Tree of Gondor in full flower  Legolas gestures behind him and Aragorn’s eyes scan among the elves  Trumpets sound as a procession of elves dressed in shimmering silvers and whites led by Legolas approach the king  Aragorn passes Eowyn and Faramir who bow before him and Éomer steps forward to bow in respect  The cheers of his people are deafening as Aragorn sings for them then walks in slow procession down the whitepaved path while the crowd bows their heads in respect to their new king  Aragorn smiles up at Gandalf and slowly rises turning to face the crowd who cheer and clap for their king  The Crown of Gondor glints in the brilliant light as Gandalf places it upon Aragorn's head  Soaring up the scene reveals the Court of the Kings crowded with 4000 people cramming the wide path leading to the tower  The scene sweeps over the Minas Tirith walls racing towards the top of the city through a blizzard of white flower petals as Minas Tirith is restored and gleams white  Frodo's and Sam's eyes meet  it is Sam  Finally Frodo's eyes fall upon a figure standing apart from the others  Aragorn joins them and the Fellowship is complete  Gimli and Legolas enter the room their joy plain  There is laughter as Merry and Pippin run in jumping on the bed and hugging Frodo  Frodo's eyes flutter open and he looks around slowly his eyes alight on Gandalf whose face breaks into a smile  Frodo's face can be seen as the fiery volcano recedes away beneath him and the wind ruffles his hair before he passes out  The eagles bravely fly amid the raining ash and molten rocks and snatch Frodo and Sam from the rock  Gwaihir the great eagle flaps towards the camera bearing Gandalf on his back and followed by two more eagles  The scene slowly fades to black  Frodo wraps an arm around Sam's shoulder as the two tiny hobbits wait to die amid the cataclysmic landscape with lava erupting around them and fireballs raining down from the sky  Frodo shuts his eyes and then glances at Sam who is weeping  Frodo and Sam crawl onto a rock as lava streams towards them and in seconds their rock becomes an island in a sea of molten lava  Frodo smiles and Sam looks down at Frodo whose face is at peace with his burden destroyed  Frodo stumbles and Sam helps him up  The screaming Nazgûl fall from the sky in flames as the ground shakes so violently that Frodo and Sam can barely stand
